**[Title]**

Psychological Support/Employee Resilience Program
-------------------------------------------------

### Notice Overview

The Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) department is seeking proposals for a psychological support and employee resilience program to support its workforce in managing the stresses of their work.

### Background

The IRCC International Network delivers Canada's immigration program abroad and manages the department's refugee resettlement program. In performing these tasks, IRCC employees may be exposed to traumas and hardships experienced by applicants and clients, such as refugees and persons in need of protection. During times of conflict, work pressures are particularly high, and employees may be at risk of experiencing trauma, vicarious trauma, secondary traumatic stress, compassion fatigue, and burnout.

### Program Overview

The proposed program will provide psychological support and resources to IRCC employees to mitigate the negative psychological impact of their work. The program will be delivered over a four-year period, with an estimated contract start date of February 1, 2023, and a contract end date of October 7, 2027.

### Key Requirements

*   The program will be delivered through an open bidding process on the Canadabuys procurement portal.
*   The selected contract will be awarded for one (1) year, with the option to renew for an additional four (4) years.
*   The estimated contract value is [insert value].
*   The program will provide support to approximately [insert number] employees.

### Trade Agreements

This procurement may be subject to trade agreements, including the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and others.

### Tendering Process

The tendering process will be conducted through an open bidding process on the Canadabuys procurement portal. A request for proposal (RFP) will be posted for a 40-calendar-day period.
